intro: Clitanthes lutea, commonly known as the yellow spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the葫芦科 (Cucurbitaceae) family, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces striking yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. The fruit is a long, slender capsule that splits open to release its seeds when mature.
